---

This is a project to create a C# implementation for the "Debug Adapter Protocol"
([DAP](https://microsoft.github.io/debug-adapter-protocol/)).

This project is primarily meant for use with the
[Bug.NET Debugger](https://github.com/BugDotNet/debugger), however there is
nothing stopping you from using it for your own needs.


<!-- ## Installation -->


<!-- ## Usage -->


## Development

Currently this project is being developed on the
[`develop`](https://github.com/BugDotNet/dap/tree/develop)
branch, changes will be merged to the
[`main`](https://github.com/BugDotNet/dap/tree/main)
branch *(the default one)* whenever there is a new release.


## License

This project (the source, the release files, e.t.c) is released under the
[MIT license](https://github.com/BugDotNet/dap/blob/main/license.md).


## Community

The Bug.NET organisation has a welcoming community that you can interact with,
either to: get help with this project; to contribute to Bug.NET; or just to
socialise.

### Discussions

The main community interactions for Bug.NET are happening on the
[discussions](https://github.com/orgs/BugDotNet/discussions)
area of the organisation.

*(All Bug.NET projects share the same discussion forum for ease of use).*

### Support

If you've ran into a problem with one of our projects *(or our organisation in
general)*, then please take a look at our
[support guide](https://github.com/BugDotNet/.github/blob/main/.github/support.md)
to learn about the best way to get help with your issue.

### Contributing

There are many different ways in which you can contribute and help the Bug.NET
project, if you'd like to learn more then take a look at our
[contributing guide](https://github.com/BugDotNet/.github/blob/main/.github/contributing.md).

### Governance

[Nightowl](https://github.com/nightowl286) will be lead the Bug.NET project as a
"[benevolent dictator for life](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benevolent_dictator_for_life)",
meaning that they will have the final say about all project decisions and
disputes. If you'd like to learn more then please read our
[governance](https://github.com/BugDotNet/.github/blob/main/.github/governance.md)
document.

### Code of conduct

Everyone participating in the Bug.NET projects, or in our community must follow
our
[code of conduct](https://github.com/BugDotNet/.github/blob/main/.github/code_of_conduct.md).
